member.name: F:SIL.FieldWorks.Build.Tasks.CircularReferencesTask.m_Cache
member.summary: The cache of references

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Performs a single step in a recursive depth-first-search traversal of the target reference tree.
The current target is first set to the "visiting" state, and pushed onto the "visiting" stack.
An exception is then thrown if any child of the current node is in the visiting state, as that implies a circular dependency. The exception contains details of the cycle, using elements of the "visiting" stack.
If any child has not already been "visited", this method is called recursively on it.
The current target is set to the "visited" state.
The assembly to inspect. A mapping from targets to states. The states in question are or . Must not be . A stack of targets which are currently being visited. Must not be . false if circular reference was detected, otherwise true.
A circular dependency is detected. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Builds an appropriate description detailing a specified circular dependency.
The dependency to stop at. Must not be . A stack of dependencies. Must not be .
A detailing the specified circular dependency.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.summary: Processing not yet finished

member.summary: Already checked

member.name: T:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.ConcatExTask
member.summary: A task that concatenates a set of files. Loosely based on Ant's Concat task.
member.remarks:
This task takes a set of input files in a fileset and concatenates them into a single file. You can either replace the output file, or append to it by using the append attribute.
The order the files are concatenated in is not especified.

member.name: T:SIL.FieldWorks.Build.Tasks.CopyAsmRefsTask
member.summary: Copies an assembly or set of assemblies and all non-GAC referenced assemblies to a directory.

remarks.para: The target directory is emptied out first, and then the Files are copied.
A can be used to select several assemblies to copy.

example.para: Copy a one assembly and all non-GAC referenced assemblies to a directory.
Copy a several assemblies and all non-GAC referenced assemblies to a directory. Copy any related files, as well.
example.code: <copyasmrefs todir="${installer.dir}" copyrelated="true"> <fileset basedir="${fwroot}/Output/${config}"> <!-- Main assembly. --> <includes name="LexEd.exe" /> <!-- Non-referenced, but required, runtime assemblies. --> <includes name="AdapterLibrary.dll" /> <includes name="LingCmnDlgs.dll" /> </fileset> </copyasmrefs>

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Set the FwRoot property if not already set.
Set the fwroot property. If set use the environment variable FWROOT, otherwise calculate the base directory from the directory where the build file is located.
<fwroot test="bld/SetupInclude.xml"/>
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The name of the file that must be found in the given relative position to fwroot.
If the environment variable FWROOT is not set, the fwroot task looks in the directory of the current build file for the test file. If it is not found there it looks in the parent directory and so on. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:NAnt.DotNet.Tasks.FwSandcastleTask
member.summary: Runs Sandcastle 2.4.10115 (1/16/2008) to create documentation.

remarks.para: See the Sandcastle home page for more information.

example.code: <target name="sandcastle-VS2005" description="Builds VS2005-style class documentation using Sandcastle"> <property name="sandcastledoctype" value="vs2005"/> <call target="sandcastle" cascade="true"/> </target> <target name="sandcastle-Hana" description="Builds Hana-style class documentation using Sandcastle"> <property name="sandcastledoctype" value="Hana"/> <call target="sandcastle" cascade="true"/> </target> <target name="sandcastle-Prototype" description="Builds class documentation using Sandcastle"> <property name="sandcastledoctype" value="Prototype"/> <call target="sandcastle" cascade="true"/> </target> <target name="sandcastle"> <fwsandcastle verbose="${verbose}" documenttype="${sandcastledoctype}" sandcastlepath="${fwroot}/bin/Sandcastle" hhpath="C:/Program Files/HTML Help Workshop" outputpath="${dir.fwoutput}/docs/HTML/FieldWorks"> <assemblies basedir="${dir.fwoutput}/${config}"> <include name="BasicUtils.dll"/> <include name="ZipUtils.dll"/> </assemblies> </fwsandcastle> <if test="${file::exists('${dir.fwoutput}/docs/FieldWorks_Classes/Chm/FieldWorks_Classes.chm')}"> <copy file="${dir.fwoutput}/docs/FieldWorks_Classes/Chm/FieldWorks_Classes.chm" tofile="${dir.fwoutput}/docs/FieldWorks_Classes.chm"/> </if> </target>

member.summary: Initializes the task.
member.param: containing the XML fragment used to define this task instance.

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets the required information about a type library from the registry
Find the path for the COM object with the specified guid (and version numbers/lcid) and store the result in the named property DbAccess.path
<gettypelib guid="{AAB4A4A1-3C83-11D4-A1BB-00C04F0C9593}" propertyname="DbAccess.path" versionmajor="1" versionminor="0" lcid="0"/>
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Imports the interfaces of an IDL file.
Import the types specified in idlfile and create a C# file output. The type will be put in namespace, and the using namespaces will be put at the beginning of the file.
<idlimp output="${dir.srcProj}\DbAccess.cs" idlfile="${dir.outputBase}\Common\DbAccessTlb.idl" namespace="SIL.FieldWorks.Common.COMInterfaces"> <using name="FwKernelLib" /> <using name="FwDbAccess" /> </idlimp>
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask
member.summary: This tasks allows you to run MIDL.exe.
member.remarks: This task only supports a small subset of the MIDL.EXE command line switches, but you can use the options element to specify any other unsupported commands you want to specify.

example.code: <midl env="win32" Oi="cf" tlb="${outputdir}\TempAtl.tlb" header="${outputdir}\TempAtl.h" iid="${outputdir}\TempAtl_i.c" proxy="${outputdir}\TempAtl_p.c" filename="TempAtl.idl" > <defines> <option name="_DEBUG"/> <option name="WIN32" value="1"/> </defines> <options> <option name="/mktyplib203"/> <option name="/error" value="allocation"/> </options> </midl>

member.name: M:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.InitializeTask(System.Xml.XmlNode)
member.summary: Initializes task and ensures the supplied attributes are valid.
member.param: Xml node used to define this task instance.

member.name: M:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.ExecuteTask
member.summary: This is where the work is done

member.name: M:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.NeedsCompiling
member.summary: Check output files to see if we need rebuilding.
member.returns: true if a rebuild is needed

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Acf
member.summary: The /acf switch allows the user to supply an explicit ACF file name. The switch also allows the use of different interface names in the IDL and ACF files.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Align
member.summary: The /align switch is functionally the same as the MIDL /Zp option and is recognized by the MIDL compiler solely for backward compatibility with MkTypLib.
member.remarks: The alignment value can be 1, 2, 4, or 8.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.AppConfig
member.summary: The /app_config switch selects application-configuration mode, which allows you to use some ACF keywords in the IDL file. With this MIDL compiler switch, you can omit the ACF and specify an interface in a single IDL file.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Char
member.summary: The /char switch helps to ensure that the MIDL compiler and C compiler operate together correctly for all char and small types.
member.remarks: Can be one of signed | unsigned | ascii7

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Client
member.summary: The /client switch directs the MIDL compiler to generate client-side C source files for an RPC interface
member.remarks: can be one of stub | none

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.CStub
member.summary: The /cstub switch specifies the name of the client stub file for an RPC interface.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.DllData
member.summary: The /dlldata switch is used to specify the file name for the generated dlldata file for a proxy DLL. The default file name Dlldata.c is used if the /dlldata switch is not specified.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Env
member.summary: The /env switch selects the environment in which the application runs.
member.remarks: It can take the values win32 and win64

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Oi
member.summary: The /Oi switch directs the MIDL compiler to use a fully-interpreted marshaling method. The /Oic and /Oicf switches provide additional performance enhancements.
member.remarks: If you specify the Oi attribute, you must set it to one of the values: - Oi="" - Oi="c" - Oi="f" - Oi="cf"

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Tlb
member.summary: The /tlb switch specifies a file name for the type library generated by the MIDL compiler.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Header
member.summary: The /header switch specifies the name of the header file.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Iid
member.summary: The /iid switch specifies the name of the interface identifier file for a COM interface, overriding the default name obtained by adding _i.c to the IDL file name.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Proxy
member.summary: The /proxy switch specifies the name of the interface proxy file for a COM interface.

member.name: P:NAnt.Contrib.Tasks.MidlExTask.Filename
member.summary: Name of .IDL file to process.

Creates the necessary entries that allows later to use an assembly without registering it.
At the time this class gets called, the assembly needs to be registered!

member.name: F:SIL.FieldWorks.Build.Tasks.RegFreeCreator.m_BaseDirectory
member.summary: The directory where the type library resides

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates the info for the executable. The info consist of:
name (from file name)
version info (from assembly)
type (hardcoded as "win32" for now)
This method also adds the root element with all necessary namespaces.
Name of the file. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates the entries for the type library and all classes defined in this type library. We can get the necessary information for the file element (file name and size) directly from the file. We get the information for the type library from the type library itself.
The parent node. Name (and path) of the file. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Processes one type info. We get the necessary information from the type library and also from the registry.
The parent element. The guid of the type library. The type info. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The LoadLibrary function maps the specified executable module into the address space of the calling process.
The name of the executable module (either a .dll or .exe file). If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the module. If the function fails, the return value is IntPtr.Zero. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The FreeLibrary function decrements the reference count of the loaded dynamic-link library (DLL). When the reference count reaches zero, the module is unmapped from the address space of the calling process and the handle is no longer valid.
The handle to the loaded DLL module.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The GetProcAddress function retrieves the address of an exported function or variable from the specified dynamic-link library (DLL).
A handle to the DLL module that contains the function or variable. The function or variable name, or the function's ordinal value. If the function succeeds, the return value is the address of the exported function or variable. If the function fails, the return value is IntPtr.Zero. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets manifest fragment files that will be included in the resulting manifest file. This can be used to pre-process the manifest files for some rarely changing Dlls.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

members.member:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Generate a file from a template and expand variables.
Generate the file GeneratedAssemblyInfo.cs from the file AssemblyInfo.cs . Generation will happen if GeneratedAssemblyInfo.cs doesn't exist, or if one of AssemblyInfo.cs, ArrayPtr.cs or DbAccessInterop.dll have changed.
<version output="${dir.srcProj}\GeneratedAssemblyInfo.cs" template="${dir.srcProj}\AssemblyInfo.cs"> <sources basedir="${dir.srcProj}"> <includes name="ArrayPtr.cs" /> </sources> <references basedir="${dir.srcProj}"> <includes name="${dir.buildOutput}/DbAccessInterop.dll" /> </references> </version>
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Users
